question_text: How would you design a highly scalable, event-driven data processing pipeline on GCP for real-time analytics?
hook_text: Build real-time analytics pipelines that scale infinitely on Google Cloud!
cta_text: Follow for daily Cloud Architect tips and interview prep.

answer_sections.title: Event Ingestion & Processing
answer_sections.text: Pub/Sub ingests events. Cloud Run processes. Scalable. Serverless. Fast.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: We start with Pub/Sub for highly decoupled, asynchronous event ingestion. Cloud Run then scales containerized services to process these events efficiently, handling varying loads seamlessly.

answer_sections.title: Data Persistence & Workflows
answer_sections.text: Firestore stores data. Workflows orchestrate complex, stateful operations.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: Processed data is persisted in Firestore, offering a flexible and scalable NoSQL database. For complex, multi-step tasks, Workflows orchestrate serverless execution across various GCP services.

answer_sections.title: Secure & Monitor
answer_sections.text: Secret Manager for credentials. Cloud Logging, Trace for observability. IAM.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: Security is paramount: use Secret Manager for sensitive credentials and IAM for least privilege access. Cloud Logging and Trace provide comprehensive observability, crucial for monitoring and debugging distributed serverless systems.
